column1: The Johor Bahru District is a district located in the southern part of Johor
column2: Malaysia. The heavily suburban/suburbanizing district covers an area of 1
column3: 063.97 km2 (410.80 sq mi) and has a population of 1.33 million. The district capital is Johor Bahru City and the administrative capital is Iskandar Puteri City. The district borders Pontian District on the west
column4: Kota Tinggi District on the east
column5: Kulai District on the north and Straits of Johor to the south. The urban centres are divided into the cities of Johor Bahru and Iskandar Puteri and the municipal of Pasir Gudang.

column1: It is host to many thriving townships such as the Tebrau area
column2: which hosts several shopping malls including a ÆON Mall
column4: Toppen Shopping Centre and an IKEA outlet.

column1: The district office is located in Johor Bahru.
Johor Bahru District is divided into 7 mukims
There are two towns (Bandar) in Johor Bahru District.
The district is highly urbanized have been divided and delegated to the three local governments with Johor Bahru City as the capital of Johor Bahru District
The Johor Bahru City Council (MBJB) governs the city centre of Johor Bahru. It also exercises jurisdiction includes Larkin
column9: Permas Jaya and partly Taman Rinting.

column1: The city council (MBIP) administers the area of the city of Iskandar Puteri which includes Skudai
The municipal council governs the eastern parts of the district with the populated areas such as Pasir Gudang

List of Johor Bahru district representatives in the State Legislative Assembly (Dewan Undangan Negeri)
The main economy activities in the district are international trading
There are a total of 41 secondary schools
column4: one technical secondary school and one fully residential school.

column1: The district has two railway stations
column2: which are Johor Bahru Sentral and Kempas Baru.

column1: The Johor Bahru Eastern Dispersal Link Expressway
column7: Johor Bahru–Kota Tinggi Highway and Senai–Desaru Expressway links most of the cities and towns in Johor Bahru District. The district is linked to other districts in Johor and other states in Peninsular Malaysia via the North–South Expressway.

column1: The district is also linked to Singapore via Johor–Singapore Causeway and Malaysia–Singapore Second Link.
Ports in the district are Johor Port
column2: Tanjung Langsat Port and Port of Tanjung Pelepas.
